Class GameEngine

java.lang.Object
com.project.Gameplay.GameEngine
public final class GameEngine extends Object
Core game engine that tracks players, categories, questions and scores. Exposes behavior used by commands to select categories/questions and answer them.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameEngine(CategoryManager category, ArrayList<Player> players, ConsoleIO consoleIO, ReportHelper reportHelper)
    Construct a GameEngine with the provided category manager, players, console IO and report helper.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addTurnSummary()
    Append a turn summary line to the report helper describing the current player's action and the outcome.

    Read the player's answer, evaluate correctness, update scores and category state, then advance to the next player's turn.

    Check whether there are no categories remaining in the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameEngine

      public GameEngine(CategoryManager category, ArrayList<Player> players, ConsoleIO consoleIO, ReportHelper reportHelper)
      Construct a GameEngine with the provided category manager, players, console IO and report helper.
      Parameters:
      category - category manager containing categories and questions
      players - the list of players participating
      consoleIO - console abstraction for input/output
      reportHelper - helper used to accumulate report entries

  • Method Details

    • selectCategory

      public void selectCategory()
      Prompt the user to select a category from the available categories. Invalid selections re-prompt until a valid category is chosen.

    • selectQuestion

      public void selectQuestion()
      Prompt the user to select a question by dollar value from the currently selected category. Invalid selections re-prompt.

    • answerQuestion

      public void answerQuestion()
      Read the player's answer, evaluate correctness, update scores and category state, then advance to the next player's turn.

    • nextPlayerTurn

      public void nextPlayerTurn()
      Rotate the active player to the next player in round-robin order and announce the active player.

    • getCurrentCategory

      public String getCurrentCategory()
      Return the currently selected category name.
      Returns:
      the currently selected category name, or null when none is selected

    • getCategoryEmpty

      public boolean getCategoryEmpty()
      Check whether there are no categories remaining in the game.
      Returns:
      true when there are no categories remaining

    • getCurrentQuestion

      public Question getCurrentQuestion()
      Return the currently selected question.
      Returns:
      the selected Question, or null when none is selected

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public Player getCurrentPlayer()
      Return the player whose turn it currently is.
      Returns:
      the active Player

    • getPlayers

      public ArrayList<Player> getPlayers()
      Return the list of players participating in the game.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Player objects

    • getLastPlayer

      public Player getLastPlayer()
      Return the player who most recently took a turn.
      Returns:
      the last Player who acted, or null if none

    • getReportHelper

      public ReportHelper getReportHelper()
      Return the report helper used to collect turn summaries and final scores.
      Returns:
      the ReportHelper instance

    • getGivenAnswer

      public String getGivenAnswer()
      Return the last answer provided by the current player.
      Returns:
      the answer string most recently given

    • isAnswerCorrect

      public boolean isAnswerCorrect()
      Determine whether the most recently provided answer matches the current question's correct answer.
      Returns:
      true if the last given answer is correct

    • getScores

      public String getScores()
      Construct a multi-line string representing current player scores.
      Returns:
      score summary for display

    • addTurnSummary

      public void addTurnSummary()
      Append a turn summary line to the report helper describing the current player's action and the outcome.
